{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3162728,"name":"Sherry Betcher","username":"CoachBet","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/coachbet/{size}/250435_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-12T14:08:42.653Z","cooked":"

We are blessed with an expert software architect/designer who has volunteered to mentor our team. I know that I have seen curriculum/videos/guides for mentors to follow. Please help me locate those. Any additional advice is welcome.

I envision every girl (we are an all-girls team) that joins our team to take at least the first few programming classes/trainings. Hoping to trigger interest and self-confidence with programming.

Hoping to begin mid-April.

You didn‚Äôt specify which language, but for Java I have a Resource Compendium I have been maintaining of just about all resources I come across.

docs.google.com

FRC Java Programming Resource Compendium

FRC Java Programming Resource Compendium Official WPILIB System Documentation +++ https://docs.wpilib.org/en/latest/ +++ Development Environment Development Environment Installation Instructions:...

For a Mentor already proficient in software development (and particularly Java), I‚Äôd honestly start them with the official Documentation and examples from WPILib to understand the control system, base APIs, and then the Command-Based framework. Then similarly go over the main Vendor Library frameworks documentation (CTRE‚Äôs Phoenix and REV‚Äôs REVLib).

Perhaps then also watch/go through the Controls Curriculum from team Spectrum 3847, first non-bold link in the WPILIB and Java section of the Compendium, and maybe some of the other tutorial videos and such.

Yes, Java is the language we‚Äôll all be learning to speak. These are great resources. Thank you very much for the help.
